meanings.definition: The force or speed of movement; impetus
meanings.sent1: The ball gained momentum as it rolled down the hill.
meanings.sent2: The car picked up momentum as it accelerated on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The momentum of the toddler running towards the ice cream truck was unstoppable.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project gave momentum to the team's progress.
meanings.sent5: The momentum of the waterfall crashing down the rocks was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The impelling force or strength possessed by a moving object
meanings.sent1: The rocket's momentum propelled it into outer space.
meanings.sent2: The train's momentum helped it climb the steep hill.
meanings.sent3: The momentum of the wind carried the kite high into the sky.
meanings.sent4: His determination provided the momentum needed to finish the race.
meanings.sent5: The momentum of the ocean waves crashing against the shore was powerful.
